description: The API service on Google Home and Chromecast devices before mid-July 2018 does not prevent DNS rebinding attacks from reading the scan_results JSON data, which allows remote attackers to determine the physical location of most web browsers by leveraging the presence of one of these devices on its l

Vendor: Google Cause: The API service on Google Home and Chromecast devices does not prevent DNS rebinding attacks, allowing attackers to access sensitive scan_results JSON data. Impact: Attackers can determine the physical location of most web browsers by leveraging the presence of Google Home and Chromecast devices on the local network.

description: The RegEx class in the XSS filter in Microsoft Internet Explorer 9 through 11 and Microsoft Edge allows remote attackers to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks and obtain sensitive information via unspecified vectors, aka "Microsoft Browser Information Disclosure Vulnerability."
cwe_explanation: <brief explanation of the vulnerability> Vendor: <vendor name> Cause: <cause of the vulnerability> Impact: <impact of the vulnerability><|eot_id|> CWE ID: 79 Explanation: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-Site Scripting') Vendor: Microsoft Cause: The RegEx class in the XSS filter in Internet Explorer and Edge does not properly neutralize or sanitize user-supplied input in the context of a web page generation process, allowing remote attackers to inject malicious scripts. Impact: Successful exploitation could allow remote attackers to conduct cross-site scripting attacks and obtain sensitive information.

description: Cross-zone scripting vulnerability in the Wizz RSS Reader before 2.1.9 extension to Mozilla Firefox allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary Javascript in the browser chrome via the RSS feed DOM.
cwe_explanation: <brief explanation of the vulnerability> Vendor: <vendor name> Cause: <cause of the vulnerability> Impact: <impact of the vulnerability><|eot_id|> CWE ID: 79 Explanation: Improper neutralization of script-related HTML tags in a web page or newswiring format. This vulnerability allows the execution of arbitrary JavaScript code in the browser's context. Vendor: Mozilla Cause: The Wizz RSS Reader extension for Mozilla Firefox did not properly sanitize the RSS feed content, allowing malicious JavaScript to be executed in the browser's chrome context. Impact: Successful exploitation could allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary JavaScript code in the browser context, potentially leading to a wide range of attacks, including stealing sensitive information, performing unauthorized actions, and compromising user data.

description: Mozilla 1.9 M8 and earlier, Mozilla Firefox 2 before 2.0.0.15, SeaMonkey 1.1.5 and other versions before 1.1.10, Netscape 9.0, and other Mozilla-based web browsers, when a user accepts an SSL server certificate on the basis of the CN domain name in the DN field, regard the certificate as also accept
cwe_explanation: <brief explanation of the vulnerability> Vendor: <vendor name> Cause: <cause of the vulnerability> Impact: <impact of the vulnerability><|eot_id|> CWE ID: 295 Explanation: This vulnerability allows an attacker to bypass the certificate validation by manipulating the Common Name (CN) field in the certificate's Distinguished Name (DN) field. This allows the browser to accept a certificate that does not match the domain name. Vendor: Mozilla Cause: The browser accepts SSL certificates based on the CN field in the certificate's DN without proper validation. Impact: This vulnerability allows man-in-the-middle attacks, where an attacker can intercept and modify traffic between the client and server.

description: Mozilla Firefox 8.0.1 and earlier does not prevent capture of data about the times of Same Origin Policy violations during IFRAME loading attempts, which makes it easier for remote attackers to determine whether a document exists in the browser cache via crafted JavaScript code.
cwe_explanation: <brief explanation of the vulnerability> Vendor: <vendor name> Cause: <cause of the vulnerability> Impact: <impact of the vulnerability><|eot_id|> CWE ID: 79 Explanation: This vulnerability allows an attacker to determine if a specific document exists in the browser cache by monitoring Same Origin Policy violations during IFRAME loading attempts. This information leakage could be used to track user behavior or perform cache-based timing attacks. Vendor: Mozilla Cause: Mozilla Firefox did not properly prevent the capture of timing information related to Same Origin Policy violations during IFRAME loading. Impact: Attackers can determine whether a document exists in the browser cache, potentially allowing them to track user behavior or perform cache-based timing attacks.

description: The WebExtension sandbox feature in browser/components/extensions/ext-tabs.js in Mozilla Firefox before 46.0 does not properly restrict principal inheritance during chrome.tabs.create and chrome.tabs.update API calls, which allows remote attackers to conduct Universal XSS (UXSS) attacks via a crafte
cwe_explanation: <brief explanation of the vulnerability> Vendor: <vendor name> Cause: <cause of the vulnerability> Impact: <impact of the vulnerability><|eot_id|> CWE ID: 20 Explanation: CWE-20 is a classic example of a type of vulnerability that allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the victim's machine. This is done by tricking the user into executing a malicious script. The vulnerability is particularly dangerous because it can be exploited by any website, making it a critical issue for web security. Vendor: Mozilla Cause: The vulnerability lies in the way the WebExtension sandbox feature handles principal inheritance during chrome.tabs.create and chrome.tabs.update API calls. This allows a malicious website to bypass the same-origin policy and execute code in the context of a different website. Impact: An attacker can execute arbitrary code on the victim's machine, potentially leading to a complete compromise of the system. This allows for a wide range of attacks, including stealing sensitive information, installing malware, and taking full control of the victim's system.

description: Unspecified "drag-and-drop vulnerability" in Opera Web Browser before 8.50 on Windows allows "unintentional file uploads."
cwe_explanation: <brief explanation of the vulnerability> Vendor: <vendor name> Cause: <cause of the vulnerability> Impact: <impact of the vulnerability><|eot_id|> CWE ID: 352 Explanation: CWE-352 is a 'Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)'. It occurs when any untrusted site can force the victim's browser to perform actions on another site where the user is currently authenticated. Vendor: Opera Software Cause: The vulnerability allowed unintended file uploads through drag-and-drop functionality in Opera Browser before version 8.50 on Windows. Impact: The vulnerability could allow attackers to perform unintended file uploads, potentially leading to unauthorized actions on the targeted site.

description: The "instanceof" operator can bypass the Xray wrapper mechanism. When called on web content from the browser itself or an extension the web content can provide its own result for that operator, possibly tricking the browser or extension into mishandling the element. This vulnerability affects Firefo

Vendor: Mozilla Cause: The "instanceof" operator can be manipulated by web content, allowing it to bypass security mechanisms and provide its own result. Impact: This vulnerability could allow malicious web content to trick the browser or extension into mishandling elements, potentially leading to security risks and unauthorized access.

description: Manually dragging and dropping an Outlook email message into the browser will trigger a page navigation when the message's mail columns are incorrectly interpreted as a URL. *Note: this issue only affects Windows operating systems with Outlook installed. Other operating systems are not affected.*. T
cwe_explanation: <brief explanation of the vulnerability> Vendor: <vendor name> Cause: <cause of the vulnerability> Impact: <impact of the vulnerability><|eot_id|> CWE ID: 362 Explanation: The vulnerability occurs when the application incorrectly interprets user-supplied input as a URL when it should not. This can lead to unintended navigation to arbitrary URLs. Vendor: Microsoft Cause: The vulnerability is caused by Outlook incorrectly interpreting email message columns as URLs when dragged and dropped into a browser. Impact: An attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability to navigate to arbitrary web pages, leading to phishing or other malicious activities.

description: During RSA key generation, bignum implementations used a variation of the Binary Extended Euclidean Algorithm which entailed significantly input-dependent flow. This allowed an attacker able to perform electromagnetic-based side channel attacks to record traces leading to the recovery of the secret
cwe_explanation: <brief explanation of the vulnerability> Vendor: <vendor name> Cause: <cause of the vulnerability> Impact: <impact of the vulnerability><|eot_id|> CWE ID: 327 Explanation: The vulnerability is related to improper implementation of cryptographic algorithms, specifically the Binary Extended Euclidean Algorithm used in RSA key generation, leading to information leakage through side-channel attacks. Vendor: OpenSSL Cause: The use of an input-dependent flow in the implementation of the Binary Extended Euclidean Algorithm during RSA key generation. Impact: Attackers could potentially recover the secret key through electromagnetic-based side-channel attacks by recording traces of the cryptographic process.

description:
When a TLS Certificate error occurs on a domain protected by the HSTS header, the browser should not allow the user to bypass the certificate error. On Firefox for Android, the user was presented with the option to bypass the error; this could only have been done by the user explicitly.
*This bu
cwe_explanation: <brief explanation of the vulnerability> Vendor: <vendor name> Cause: <cause of the vulnerability> Impact: <impact of the vulnerability><|eot_id|> CWE ID: 614 Explanation: The vulnerability allows users to bypass certificate validation errors by providing an option to do so in the browser, potentially leading to man-in-the-middle attacks. Vendor: Mozilla Cause: Firefox for Android provided an option to bypass TLS certificate errors, allowing users to proceed despite the error. Impact: Users could potentially be subject to man-in-the-middle attacks, compromising their sensitive information and transactions.

description:
Members of the DEVMODEW struct set by the printer device driver weren't being validated and could have resulted in invalid values which in turn would cause the browser to attempt out of bounds access to related variables.
*This bug only affects Firefox on Windows. Other operating sys

cwe_explanation: <brief explanation of the vulnerability> Vendor: <vendor name> Cause: <cause of the vulnerability> Impact: <impact of the vulnerability><|eot_id|> CWE ID: 79 Explanation: CWE-79 is a classic web vulnerability that allows an attacker to inject malicious scripts into web pages viewed by other users. In this case, it specifically involves stored XSS, where the malicious content is stored in the database and then served back to other users. Vendor: Cacti Cause: The vulnerability arises because Cacti, when storing user-supplied data in the database, does not properly sanitize or validate the input, allowing malicious scripts to be stored. Impact: An authenticated user can inject malicious scripts into the data stored in the Cacti database. When other users view this data, the injected scripts are executed in their browsers, potentially allowing the attacker to steal sensitive information, perform unauthorized actions, or compromise the user's system.

cwe_explanation: <brief explanation of the vulnerability> Vendor: <vendor name> Cause: <cause of the vulnerability> Impact: <impact of the vulnerability><|eot_id|> CWE ID: 79 Explanation: CWE-79 is a classic web vulnerability where an attacker can inject malicious scripts into content resulting in an unwanted behavior on the targeted end user's browser. The vulnerability allows an authenticated user to store malicious content in the database that will be executed when viewed by administrative users. Vendor: Cacti Cause: Insufficient validation of user-supplied input before storing it in the database Impact: Successful exploitation could lead to the execution of arbitrary code on the victim's browser, session hijacking, and other attacks against the administrative users.

description: @koa/cors npm provides Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) for koa, a web framework for Node.js. Prior to version 5.0.0, the middleware operates in a way that if an allowed origin is not provided, it will return an `Access-Control-Allow-Origin` header with the value of the origin from the request.

description: ELECOM wireless LAN routers contain a cross-site scripting vulnerability. Assume that a malicious administrative user configures the affected product with specially crafted content. When another administrative user logs in and operates the product, an arbitrary script may be executed on the web brow
cwe_explanation: <brief explanation of the vulnerability> Vendor: <vendor name> Cause: <cause of the vulnerability> Impact: <impact of the vulnerability><|eot_id|> CWE ID: 79 Explanation: Improper neutralization of special elements used in an OS Command (CWE-79) is a common web vulnerability that occurs when user-supplied data is used to construct a command or query without proper validation or encoding. This allows attackers to inject malicious commands or scripts. Vendor: ELECOM Cause: The vulnerability occurs when the ELECOM wireless LAN router fails to properly sanitize or encode user-supplied input in the administrative interface, allowing a malicious administrator to inject arbitrary script content. Impact: Successful exploitation could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary scripts on the web browser of other administrative users, potentially leading to unauthorized access, data theft, or system compromise.

description: The logout operation in the CloudStack web interface does not expire the user session completely which is valid until expiry by time or restart of the backend service. An attacker that has access to a user's browser can use an unexpired session to gain access to resources owned by the logged out use
cwe_explanation: <brief explanation of the vulnerability> Vendor: <vendor name> Cause: <cause of the vulnerability> Impact: <impact of the vulnerability><|eot_id|> CWE ID: 522 Explanation: CWE-522 is a vulnerability where an application does not properly manage the session or session tokens, leading to the potential for unauthorized access to resources or data. This can occur when sessions are not properly invalidated or terminated, allowing an attacker to maintain access through an unexpired session. Vendor: Apache Software Foundation Cause: The CloudStack web interface does not properly expire user sessions when a user logs out, leaving the session active until it expires by time or the backend service is restarted. Impact: An attacker with access to a user's browser can maintain access to resources owned by the logged-out user until the session expires or the backend service is restarted.
